result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:42 AM Defendant Domonic J Coon in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Domonic J Coon.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.

State has complied with victim's rights. 
Court recites the offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 5 & 6.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Defense requests a PSI. 
Court orders a PSI for the sentencing hearing to be filed by 11/15/22. 
Court revokes bond.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:30 AM Defendant Domonic J Coon in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty. Ronald Sonderhouse.

Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:55 PM Defendant Domonic J Coon in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kees states their office has reached out to 72 attorneys and have not yet been successful obtaining counsel for the defendant.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant in regards to having counsel.  Court places findings on the record and finds good cause to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  The defendant indicates he is willing to waive the time limits associated with the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court cancels the preliminary hearing set for tomorrow and will adjourn but still schedule this matter in a timely fashion.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victims A-E/co-actor (Angelina Soto) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
